Key Match Events: Jamal Musiala tormented Hungary out wide but his acuity in occupying pockets of space more centrally was fundamental to the moments that won this game.
Ilkay Gündogan intervened decisively midway through each half, creating the opener for Jamal Musiala and sweeping in a second goal that finally deflated a largely impressive Hungary.
Manuel Neuer brilliantly repelled a Dominik Szoboszlai free-kick and blocked the rebound from Barnabas Varga.
Julian Nagelsmann pointed out that Jamal Musiala had kept Germany on the straight and narrow when they were listing, off the ball.
A late goalline clearance from Joshua Kimmich ensured the bank of almost 20,000 fans behind Neuer’s goal were left with nothing bar an improved showing to savour.
Pre-Game Insights: Hungary’s Marco Rossi accused Germany of 'double standard' after the match.
Post-Match Reflections: Gündogan said Jamal Musiala is a dazzling constant and that 'the way he’s going right now, he can be one of the best.'
Julian Nagelsmann praised Jamal Musiala’s performance, saying he worked amazingly and tried to steer the match.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at the Stuttgart Arena in front of a crowd of almost 20,000 fans.
Germany's momentum is gathering, and they have begun this summer with the dead-eyed edge of old.
Others: Germany were clinical and their momentum is gathering.
Hungary are on the brink of elimination.
